universityKnowledgeBase.question: What is the minimum CGPA to avoid academic probation?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Students must maintain a minimum CGPA of 2.00 to remain in good academic standing. A CGPA below 2.00 results in academic probation. Students on probation have one semester to improve their CGPA to 2.00 or above, failing which they may face dismissal.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What CGPA is required for graduation?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Students need a minimum CGPA of 2.00 to graduate. For honors classification: First Class (CGPA 3.67-4.00), Upper Second Class (CGPA 3.00-3.66), Lower Second Class (CGPA 2.50-2.99), and Pass (CGPA 2.00-2.49).

universityKnowledgeBase.question: How many credit hours are required for graduation?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Bachelor degree programs typically require 120-130 credit hours. Engineering programs may require up to 140 credit hours. Students must complete all core courses, major requirements, and electives as specified in their program structure.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What is the deadline for course withdrawal?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Students can withdraw from courses without academic penalty before Week 10 of the semester. Withdrawal after this deadline results in a "W" grade. Late withdrawal requires approval from the Dean and may affect financial aid.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: Can I repeat a failed course?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Yes, students can repeat failed courses (Grade F). The new grade replaces the previous grade in CGPA calculation. However, both grades appear on the transcript. Students can repeat a course maximum of 2 times.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: When is course registration for Semester 1 2025?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Course registration for Semester 1 2025: Early Registration (May 15-30), Regular Registration (June 1-15), Late Registration (June 16-22 with penalty fee). New students register during orientation week.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: How do I register for courses?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Log into the Student Information System (SIS), select "Course Registration", choose your courses based on your study plan, ensure prerequisites are met, and submit registration. Payment must be completed within 7 days.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What is the maximum credit load per semester?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Regular students can take 15-18 credit hours per semester. Students with CGPA 3.50 and above can take up to 21 credit hours. Minimum load is 12 credit hours for full-time status. Part-time students can take 6-11 credit hours.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: When can I add or drop courses?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Add/Drop period is during the first two weeks of semester. Adding courses requires instructor approval if class is full. Dropping during this period does not appear on transcript. 100% fee refund for dropped courses.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: When are final exams for Semester 1 2025?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Final examinations for Semester 1 2025 are scheduled from December 2-16, 2025. Exam timetables are published 4 weeks before exams. Students must check their individual exam schedule on SIS.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What items are allowed during exams?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Students must bring student ID and stationery. Calculators are allowed only if specified by instructor. Mobile phones, smartwatches, and electronic devices must be switched off. Programmable calculators are prohibited unless explicitly allowed.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: Can I take a special exam if I miss the final?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Special exams are granted only for medical emergencies, family bereavement, or other exceptional circumstances. Medical certificate or official documentation required. Application must be submitted within 3 days of missed exam.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: How do I appeal my exam grade?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Grade appeals must be submitted within 2 weeks of grade publication. Submit appeal form to Academic Affairs with clear justification. Review committee examines the case. Final decision is communicated within 4 weeks.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What are the library operating hours?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Main Library: Monday-Thursday (8:00 AM - 10:00 PM), Friday (8:00 AM - 12:00 PM, 2:30 PM - 10:00 PM), Saturday-Sunday (9:00 AM - 6:00 PM). 24-hour study areas available during exam periods.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What financial aid options are available?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Financial aid includes PTPTN loans, scholarships, work-study programs, and emergency funds. Applications open in January for the following academic year. Maintain CGPA 2.50+ for aid continuation. Contact Student Affairs for guidance.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: Where can I get medical attention on campus?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Campus Health Center operates Monday-Friday (8:00 AM - 5:00 PM). Services include general consultation, first aid, health screening, and emergency care. For serious emergencies, contact Security (ext. 999) for ambulance.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: When is the next convocation ceremony?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Convocation ceremonies are held twice yearly - June and November. June 2025 convocation is scheduled for June 15-17. Students must apply for graduation by March 31 for June ceremony. Gown rental and photography services available.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: How do I request official transcripts?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Official transcripts can be requested online through SIS or at Registrar Office. Processing time: 3-5 working days for online requests, same day for urgent requests (additional fee). Digital transcripts available for verified employers.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: How do I connect to campus WiFi?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Connect to "UniWiFi" network using your student ID and SIS password. Coverage available in all academic buildings, library, cafeterias, and dormitories. Guest WiFi available for visitors with daily access codes from IT Help Desk.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: Where can I park on campus?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Student parking available in designated areas with valid parking permit. Annual parking permit: RM50 for motorcycles, RM100 for cars. Visitor parking: RM2/hour. Parking violations result in RM30 fine.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What are the important dates for Semester 1 2025?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Semester 1 2025: Registration (June 1-15), Classes Begin (June 22), Mid-semester Break (August 10-18), Last Day of Classes (November 15), Study Week (November 18-22), Final Exams (December 2-16), Grade Publication (December 23).

universityKnowledgeBase.question: Which public holidays affect the academic calendar?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Classes are suspended during Malaysian public holidays including Hari Raya, Chinese New Year, Deepavali, Christmas, and Independence Day. State-specific holidays also apply. Holiday makeup classes may be scheduled if necessary.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What constitutes academic misconduct?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Academic misconduct includes plagiarism, cheating, fabrication of data, unauthorized collaboration, and multiple submissions. Penalties range from warning to expulsion depending on severity. All suspected cases are investigated by Academic Integrity Committee.

universityKnowledgeBase.question: What is the campus dress code?
universityKnowledgeBase.answer: Business casual attire required in academic buildings. No sleeveless tops, shorts above knee length, or slippers allowed in lectures/labs. Formal attire required for presentations and official events. Religious and cultural dress respected.
